acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rat LD50:> 4g/kg and rabbit LD50> 5g/kg (RTECS (2004)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: It was classified as Category 3 based on rat LC50: 2116ppm/4h (RTECS (2004)). (The saturated vapor concentration at 20degC is 6.2*10^(5) ppm)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on rat LD50: 475 mg/kg (RTECS (2004)). Although Priorty2 had two reports, the value of the lower one was adopted.

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Although dynamic viscosity could be caluculated (0.332mm2/s), we could not classify it since we found no animal experiment data of chemical pneumonia.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data and reports

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Ames test: We found a negative statement (IUCLID (2000)), but we did not have the in vivo report. Therefore we presupposed that we could not classify it according to the technical guideline.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: It is the liquid with ignition points of 449 degC (ICSC (1997)), and it does not ignite in room temperatures.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since there was no data, it was presupposed that it cannot classify. [special notes] Should the reproductive toxicity of the generated methanol (since methyl formates are easily hydrodised intravital) also be referred to?

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There are statements of stimulative with humans (PATTY (5th, 2001)), and of stimulative in rabbit test (IUCLID (2000)). But there is no resilience data, Category of 2A and 2B is not made. When a display is required, it is recommended of making it 2A from a viewpoint of safety.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There was a report of having no irritation on rabbits (IUCLID (2000)). But based on the statement of stimulativeness on humans (PATTY (5th, 2001)), it was classified as Category 3.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (central nervous system),
Category 2 (visual organs),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation),
Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (central nervous system)
May cause damage to organs (visual organs)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: High concentration exposure causes a convulsion (PATTY (5th, 2001)), there is the description that it is with coma, central nervous system inhibition (HSDB (2005)), and it is classified into Category 1 (central nervous). And the vision disorder may come to be blind (HSDB (2005); proirity 2). And there is the description that it come to mucosa irritation (PATTY (5th, 2001)), nose irritation (HSDB (2005)), so it is classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritation). And there is the description that there is anesthetic action (PATTY (5th, 2001)), it is classified into Category 3 (anesthetic action).
